re! Give me some slack! LOL
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <=
warrior18eii@...> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...>=

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday,=
 June 8, 2009, 3:16 PM













Sorry, RJ. I stand corrected! Soundwave=
s are not EM waves because they lack the EM component and are subject to ou=
r physical environment. Hence, cannot travel at the speed of light. 
=A0
Th=
at being said, the heterodyne theory still stands. LOL
=A0
Frank R.

--- On=
 Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ra=
tka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:05 PM









Tell me where=
 the seperation on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, =
soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears read as vibration and our min=
d translates as sound. The waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum.=
 Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. What I mean by p=
ower can be directll translated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that=
 distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that we can hear =
them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


F=
rom: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds wav=
es are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromagn=
et energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in other =
substances).=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and translate them int=
o sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes =
do: that part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Rat=
ka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yaho=
o.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: =
Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's saying "one, t=
wo, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there a=
re two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and e=
lectromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and p=
ower. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of th=
e electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just f=
arther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penet=
rate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the waveleng=
th the more ways we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These=
 are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves als=
o have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed u=
p, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too ca=
n cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to=
 rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the tota=
l system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank=
 R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch=
. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. c=
om>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thoug=
ht. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
=
It was me and another girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3r=
d female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were s=
tanding right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my=
 night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have =
asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked=
 it up.
=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in=
 the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Some=
how EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with =
the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have pick=
ed that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attach=
ing the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" =
is the full clip.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then anothe=
r comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was =
live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playback. It is=
n't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the last invest=
igation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] New ideas








I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an u=
ntrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It w=
orks off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that dif=
fer one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you =
get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sen=
ding a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an u=
ntrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=
=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This=
 was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic sig=
nals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were =
generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce=
 this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with a=
coustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce calle=
d the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zac=
k@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM





Fascinating! I've had this idea t=
hat the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow make the=
ir way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, whether it be an=
alog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon,=
 Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch=
. com> wrote:









I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that eve=
n so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environment,=
 or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=A0


=
----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New idea=
s




I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has e=
ver gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of=
 Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video came=
ras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=A0was bein=
g monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have mic=
rophones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder wha=
t we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0

st agree to end this discussion about her...

g on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp or ITC?

DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and d=
emodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterod=
yne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in f=
requency then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency=
 or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54K=
Hz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency =
at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KH=
z, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an exampl=
e, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turnin=
g them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a =
few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to rep=
roduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also =
with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce=
 called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV=
>
